subject: Psychology
title: The Replication Crisis
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Replication Crisis usable.

hook.text: Half of psychology's famous findings failed to replicate. The science of the mind had a crisis of confidence.

buildup.text: In 2015, the Reproducibility Project retested 100 studies. Only 36% replicated with the same strength.

discovery.text: Publication bias, small samples, and p-hacking (massaging data) inflated many classic findings.

twist.text: The crisis wasn't a failure of psychology â€” it was psychology doing what science should: self-correcting.

climax.text: Pre-registration, larger samples, and open data are now standard. Psychology emerged stronger from the crisis.

punchline.text: The crisis wasn't the disease. It was the immune response.

quiz.question: What did the Reproducibility Project find?
options: Only 36 percent of studies replicated with the same strength
